metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1073 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A memory corruption flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s human interface device (HID) subsystem in how a user inserts a malicious USB device. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system. It was discovered that the Human Interface Device (HID) support driver in the Linux kernel contained a type confusion vulnerability in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1073` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-aws - 4.4.0-1119.125
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-azure - 4.15.0-1163.178~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-lowlatency - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-azure - 4.15.0-1163.178~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-lowlatency - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.125').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1163.178~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1163.178~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1').
